oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Polk Place Interior
Large Room in Polk Place
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This photograph shows a large room with many pieces of furniture and a wood stove. It appears cluttered and possibly underkept, indicating it may have been taken in the later years of her life.

Polk Place, on Capitol Hill, was remodeled by President and Mrs. James K. Polk to serve as a retirement residence after he left Washington when his term concluded in 1848. Polk died 15 June 1849. His portrait is visible in this photograph at right rear. Sarah Childress Polk resided at Polk Place during the Civil War and continued to live in the home until her death on 14 August 1891. She remained publicly neutral during the war and was known for her hospitality.
